data.text: @AusRepublic The problem for the future of republicanism, as I see it, is that the rising new Millennials do not see monarchy through a national prism, but through a global lens. Only 12% of this cohort say “patriotism” is a word that accurately reflects the values of their generation

@AusRepublic It was, after all, this intractable perception as well as the working reality, that the queen is seen as primarily Britain’s monarch, rather than equally the sovereign of her various realms, that gave rise to republican nationalism in the first place

@AusRepublic That’s not to say I don’t sympathize with part of what Keating is saying. The problem is not the monarchy in Canada, Australia and New Zealand, it’s this derivative status. Constitutionally we are monarchies, but in practice we’re a “governor-generalship”
@AusRepublic Keating making hay, but he out of all people should know that a cause without a single political champion is a cause that must die
@AusRepublic He's a creep, a hypocrite, and probably a murderer...Can't stand the prick...
